drupalNodeEvent.title: Facing the New Geopolitics: China at the Poles

field_speakers.processed: Featuring Anne-Marie Brady, Professor, China Studies, University of Canterbury, New Zealand, and moderated by Leela Fernandes, UW Jackson School of International Studies Director and Stanley D. Golub Endowed Chair.

field_organizers.processed: Sponsored by The Henry M. Jackson School of International Studies and the Center for Global Studies, University of Washington. Co-sponsored by the Canadian Studies Center/Arctic and International Relations, China Studies Program, and the East Asia Center.

field_description.processed: This talk explores international relations between China and the Arctic.
